content.description: Stand start. Hug and heel-hook the blade, making sure not to miss a nice long left sidepull up high.
content.location: 5 feet downhill from The Kindest Cut.

content.description: This would be a cool, committing problem. I've done the moves hanging from a Gri-gri, but wasn't inspired enough to drop the rope. Ee careful if you try it!
content.protection: The landing is awful. There is a small flat spot, but with great potential for cart-wheeling into the pit if falling from high up.
content.location: This route is on the same boulder as Sling Blade. Walk right from sling blade to the face above the abyss.

content.description: SDS with right hand on incut right-facing sidepull, left hand grabbing left arete. Bounce your way through interesting angular features, utilizing creative right foot heel-hooking.
content.protection: A few pads tethered to stable boulders higher up. You can really test your anchor building skills here. I'm not kidding.
content.location: Pass the small cave and look for a thin A-frame fin of rock with beautifully sculpted slopers. The boulder is approximately 40 feet downhill from the overlook.

content.description: This area is subject to heavy vegetation in the warmer months, and thus, is most accessible in the winter, late fall or early spring.
